description: Retrieves the maintenance windows in an Amazon Web Services account.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: Optional filters used to narrow down the scope of the returned maintenance windows. Supported filter keys are Name and Enabled. For example, Name=MyMaintenanceWindow and Enabled=True. (dict) --- Filter used in the request. Supported filter keys depend on the API operation that includes the filter. API operations that use MaintenanceWindowFilter> include the following: DescribeMaintenanceWindowExecutions DescribeMaintenanceWindowExecutionTaskInvocations DescribeMaintenanceWindowExecutionTasks DescribeMaintenanceWindows DescribeMaintenanceWindowTargets DescribeMaintenanceWindowTasks Key (string) --- The name of the filter. Values (list) --- The filter values. (string) ---

nested_items.name: WindowId
nested_items.description: The ID of the maintenance window.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the maintenance window.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the maintenance window.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the maintenance window is enabled.

nested_items.name: Duration
nested_items.description: The duration of the maintenance window in hours.

nested_items.name: Cutoff
nested_items.description: The number of hours before the end of the maintenance window that Amazon Web Services Systems Manager stops scheduling new tasks for execution.

nested_items.name: Schedule
nested_items.description: The schedule of the maintenance window in the form of a cron or rate expression.

nested_items.name: ScheduleTimezone
nested_items.description: The time zone that the scheduled maintenance window executions are based on, in Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) format.

nested_items.name: ScheduleOffset
nested_items.description: The number of days to wait to run a maintenance window after the scheduled cron expression date and time.

nested_items.name: EndDate
nested_items.description: The date and time, in ISO-8601 Extended format, for when the maintenance window is scheduled to become inactive.

nested_items.name: StartDate
nested_items.description: The date and time, in ISO-8601 Extended format, for when the maintenance window is scheduled to become active.

nested_items.name: NextExecutionTime
nested_items.description: The next time the maintenance window will actually run, taking into account any specified times for the maintenance window to become active or inactive.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to use when requesting the next set of items. If there are no additional items to return, the string is empty.
